paragraphs.content: Chapter 36
paragraphs.contentHtml: Chapter 36

paragraphs.content: Elihu also proceeded, and said,
paragraphs.contentHtml: Elihu also proceeded, and said,

paragraphs.content: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God’s behalf.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Suffer me a little, and I will shew thee that I have yet to speak on God’s behalf.

paragraphs.content: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
paragraphs.contentHtml: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, and will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.

paragraphs.content: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For truly my words shall not be false: he that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.

paragraphs.content: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: he is mighty in strength and wisdom.

paragraphs.content: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He preserveth not the life of the wicked: but giveth right to the poor.

paragraphs.content: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: but with kings are they on the throne; yea, he doth establish them for ever, and they are exalted.

paragraphs.content: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;
paragraphs.contentHtml: And if they be bound in fetters, and be holden in cords of affliction;

paragraphs.content: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Then he sheweth them their work, and their transgressions that they have exceeded.

paragraphs.content: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He openeth also their ear to discipline, and commandeth that they return from iniquity.

paragraphs.content: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.
paragraphs.contentHtml: If they obey and serve him, they shall spend their days in prosperity, and their years in pleasures.

paragraphs.content: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But if they obey not, they shall perish by the sword, and they shall die without knowledge.

paragraphs.content: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But the hypocrites in heart heap up wrath: they cry not when he bindeth them.

paragraphs.content: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.
paragraphs.contentHtml: They die in youth, and their life is among the unclean.

paragraphs.content: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.
paragraphs.contentHtml: He delivereth the poor in his affliction, and openeth their ears in oppression.

paragraphs.content: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Even so would he have removed thee out of the strait into a broad place, where there is no straitness; and that which should be set on thy table should be full of fatness.

paragraphs.content: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: But thou hast fulfilled the judgment of the wicked: judgment and justice take hold on thee.

paragraphs.content: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Because there is wrath, beware lest he take thee away with his stroke: then a great ransom cannot deliver thee.

paragraphs.content: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Will he esteem thy riches? no, not gold, nor all the forces of strength.

paragraphs.content: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Desire not the night, when people are cut off in their place.

paragraphs.content: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Take heed, regard not iniquity: for this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.

paragraphs.content: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, God exalteth by his power: who teacheth like him?

paragraphs.content: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Who hath enjoined him his way? or who can say, Thou hast wrought iniquity?

paragraphs.content: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Remember that thou magnify his work, which men behold.

paragraphs.content: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Every man may see it; man may behold it afar off.

paragraphs.content: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, God is great, and we know him not, neither can the number of his years be searched out.

paragraphs.content: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:
paragraphs.contentHtml: For he maketh small the drops of water: they pour down rain according to the vapour thereof:

paragraphs.content: Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Which the clouds do drop and distil upon man abundantly.

paragraphs.content: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?
paragraphs.contentHtml: Also can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, or the noise of his tabernacle?

paragraphs.content: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.
paragraphs.contentHtml: Behold, he spreadeth his light upon it, and covereth the bottom of the sea.

paragraphs.content: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.
paragraphs.contentHtml: For by them judgeth he the people; he giveth meat in abundance.

paragraphs.content: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.
paragraphs.contentHtml: With clouds he covereth the light; and commandeth it not to shine by the cloud that cometh betwixt.

paragraphs.content: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
paragraphs.contentHtml: The noise thereof sheweth concerning it, the cattle also concerning the vapour.
